comments.body:
`continuumio/miniconda3` uses python 3.9 by default, but for some reason `pyarrow` can't be built in Python 3.9:

https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/runs/3157648572#step:5:761

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +10,14 @@    # cmake and protobuf-compiler required for onnx install
    cmake protobuf-compiler &&  \
    conda install python=3.6 && \
    # install required python packages
    pip install -r dev-requirements.txt --no-cache-dir && \

comments.body: Added these changes to trigger the docker test otherwise it'd be skipped

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +6,10 @@
RUN apt-get update && \
    # install prequired modules to support install of mlflow and related components
    apt-get install -y default-libmysqlclient-dev build-essential curl \
    # cmake and protobuf-compiler required for onnx install

comments.body:
Fix for https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/runs/872426168#step:5:1884

```
...
Find out more about deployment here:

  https://bit.ly/CRA-deploy

Error processing tar file(exit status 1): mkdir /root/.npm/_cacache/index-v5/fc: no space left on device
##[error]Process completed with exit code 1.
```

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +14,18 @@    pip install -r test-requirements.txt --no-cache-dir && \
# install mlflow in editable form
    pip install --no-cache-dir -e . && \
# mkdir required to support install openjdk-11-jre-headless
    mkdir -p /usr/share/man/man1 && apt-get install -y openjdk-11-jre-headless && \
